meanings.definition: Bright or showy in a way that attracts attention
meanings.sent1: The flashy fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She wore a flashy dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The flashy peacock strutted around the garden, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The flashy sports car zoomed past us on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The flashy neon sign caught everyone's eye from afar.

meanings.definition: Tending to show off or attract attention in a bold or extravagant way
meanings.sent1: His flashy jewelry always made him stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The flashy magician amazed the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The flashy dancer twirled and spun on the stage, stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: Her flashy personality made her the center of attention wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The flashy advertisement on the billboard grabbed everyone's gaze.

meanings.definition: Quickly moving or changing, especially in a way that is exciting or impressive
meanings.sent1: The flashy race cars sped around the track, thrilling the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The flashy lights of the city skyline dazzled the tourists.
meanings.sent3: The flashy music video had us tapping our feet and bobbing our heads.
meanings.sent4: The flashy action movie kept us on the edge of our seats with its fast-paced scenes.
meanings.sent5: The flashy meteor streaked across the night sky, leaving a trail of light behind.
